hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util

Class Closeables

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.Closeables

  • public final class Closeables
extends Object
    Utility methods for various closeable objects.
    Since:
    0.95
    Author:
    akarnokd, 2011.10.26.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void close(Closeable... closeables)
      Closes the given array of closeables and returns a MultiIOException of the thrown exceptions.
      static void close(Closeable c, boolean silently)
      Closes the given closeable silently or wrapped as RuntimeException depending on the parameter.
      static void close(Iterable<? extends Closeable> closeables)
      Closes the given sequence of closeables and returns a MultiIOException of the thrown exceptions.
      static void close(Object o)
      If the target object implements Closeable, this method calls it, otherwise its a no-op.
      static void close(Object c, boolean silently)
      Closes the given potentially closeable instance silently or wrapped as RuntimeException depending on the parameter.
      static void closeSilently(Closeable c)
      Invoke the close() method on the closeable instance and throw away any IOException it might raise.
      static void closeSilently(Object o)
      Closes the given object if it implements the Closeable interface.
      static void closeUnchecked(Closeable c)
      Closes the given closeable instance and wraps the IOException into a RuntimeException.
      static void closeUnchecked(Object c)
      Closes the given object if it implements the Closeable interface and wraps the IOException into a RuntimeException.
      static Closeable emptyCloseable()
      Returns an empty closeable object which does nothing.
      static Closeable newCloseable(Closeable c0, Closeable c1, Closeable... closeables)
      Wraps two or more closeables into one closeable.
      static Closeable newCloseable(Iterable<? extends Closeable> closeables)
      Creates a composite closeable from the array of closeables.
      static Closeable toCloseable(Action0 action)
      Wraps the given action into a Closeable.
      static Closeable toCloseable(Action0E<? extends IOException> action)
      Wraps the given action into a Closeable.

    • Method Detail

      • emptyCloseable

        @Nonnull
public static Closeable emptyCloseable()
        Returns an empty closeable object which does nothing.
        Returns:
        an empty, no-op closeable instance.

      • newCloseable

        @Nonnull
public static Closeable newCloseable(@Nonnull
                             Closeable c0,
                             @Nonnull
                             Closeable c1,
                             @Nonnull
                             Closeable... closeables)
        Wraps two or more closeables into one closeable. IOExceptions thrown from the closeables are suppressed.
        Parameters:
        c0 - the first closeable
        c1 - the second closeable
        closeables - the rest of the closeables
        Returns:
        the composite closeable
        Since:
        0.97

      • closeSilently

        public static void closeSilently(Closeable c)
        Invoke the close() method on the closeable instance and throw away any IOException it might raise.
        Parameters:
        c - the closeable instance, nulls are simply ignored
        Since:
        0.97

      • closeUnchecked

        public static void closeUnchecked(@Nullable
                  Closeable c)
        Closes the given closeable instance and wraps the IOException into a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        c - the closeable instance, null means no-op
        Since:
        0.97

      • close

        public static void close(@Nullable
         Closeable c,
         boolean silently)
        Closes the given closeable silently or wrapped as RuntimeException depending on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        c - the closeable
        silently - close silently?

      • close

        public static void close(@Nullable
         Object c,
         boolean silently)
        Closes the given potentially closeable instance silently or wrapped as RuntimeException depending on the parameter.
        Parameters:
        c - the closeable
        silently - close silently?
        Since:
        0.97

      • closeUnchecked

        public static void closeUnchecked(@Nullable
                  Object c)
        Closes the given object if it implements the Closeable interface and wraps the IOException into a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        c - the closeable instance, null means no-op
        Since:
        0.97

      • newCloseable

        @Nonnull
public static Closeable newCloseable(@Nonnull
                             Iterable<? extends Closeable> closeables)
        Creates a composite closeable from the array of closeables. IOExceptions thrown from the closeables are suppressed.
        Parameters:
        closeables - the closeables array
        Returns:
        the composite closeable

      • closeSilently

        public static void closeSilently(@Nullable
                 Object o)
        Closes the given object if it implements the Closeable interface.
        Parameters:
        o - an object
        Since:
        0.97

      • close

        public static void close(Closeable... closeables)
                  throws MultiIOException
        Closes the given array of closeables and returns a MultiIOException of the thrown exceptions.
        Parameters:
        closeables - the array of closeables
        Throws:
        MultiIOException - if one or more close() calls threw

      • close

        public static void close(Iterable<? extends Closeable> closeables)
                  throws MultiIOException
        Closes the given sequence of closeables and returns a MultiIOException of the thrown exceptions.
        Parameters:
        closeables - the sequence of closeables
        Throws:
        MultiIOException - if one or more close() calls threw

      • close

        public static void close(Object o)
                  throws IOException
        If the target object implements Closeable, this method calls it, otherwise its a no-op.
        Parameters:
        o - the object to close
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception thrown by the close() method
        Since:
        0.97

public static Closeable toCloseable(@Nonnull

        Returns:
        the closeable instance
